headline: Bad Bunny, the anti-Trump icon made in Puerto Rico
subhead: On Sunday, in front of tens of millions of television viewers, the Puerto Rican reggaeton phenomenon will headline the Super Bowl halftime show, on the heels of winning Album of the Year at the Grammys. But, at a time when the ruthless crackdown on undocumented immigrants is raging in the US, inviting this Latin icon to one of America's major events was always bound to anger Donald Trump.

headline: France opens investigation into former minister Jack Lang over Epstein files
The Netherlands learns a lesson on right and far-right alliances
Danone recalls batches of infant formula in Britain, Spain, Croatia and Slovenia over potential toxin
subhead: Several manufacturers have issued recalls of infant formula in more than 60 countries since December. The UK said it was investigating 36 cases where children developed 'symptoms consistent with cereulide toxin poisoning.'

headline: In Syria's Roj detention camp, jihadist women are convinced they will soon be 'freed'
subhead: The female prisoners, mostly foreign nationals who joined the Islamic State group in the 2010s, celebrate the advance of Syrian government forces, who are set to retake control of the camps and prisons in the Kurdish autonomous region under the January 30 agreement.

headline: Glitz, Opera and Alpine Spectacle Mark Opening of Milan-Cortina Olympics
subhead: Athletes paraded across multiple Alpine venues as organizers launched the most geographically dispersed Games in Olympic history, while Lindsey Vonn’s injury-defying comeback drew early attention. Celebrations in Milan unfolded alongside protests over the presence of U.S. immigration agents supporting the American delegation.

headline: Richard Reeves, the researcher studying the suffering of the modern man
subhead: Keen to combat the exploitation of male discontent by the far right, Reeves, who founded the American Institute for Boys and Men think tank, wrote a book that explains the appeal of this political current to men.

headline: Islamic State claims responsibility for attack on Shiite mosque that killed at least 31 in Pakistan
Iran anticipates more negotiations with the US, citing a 'positive atmosphere' during talks in Oman
Director of France's Museum of Immigration History: 'Fraternity has played a much greater role in our history than surges of xenophobia'
2026 Winter Olympics open amid geopolitical and climate tensions
Trump's racist video about Obamas is deleted after backlash
Iranian photojournalist shares unseen images of Tehran protests
Norway crown princess 'deeply regrets' Epstein friendship
French government expects resistance from Jack Lang after summons to explain Epstein ties
EU tells TikTok to change its 'addictive' design or face fines
Three years after an earthquake killed 54,000 people in Turkey, legal proceedings stall
France detects Russia-linked Epstein smear attempt against Macron, says government source
France warns of possible 'IS resurgence' in Syria, where 'French citizens' security is also at stake'
Jeffrey Epstein's business ties with banker Ariane de Rothschild revealed
subhead: The latest release of the Epstein files by the US Department of Justice has confirmed the extremely close relationship between the French-German head of the Edmond de Rothschild group and the convicted sex offender. From 2013 until his death in 2019, he acted as an unofficial adviser to the Switzerland-based bank.

headline: European intelligence services adapt to the upheavals of the Trump era
subhead: Shaken by Donald Trump's unpredictable behavior, European intelligence services, long reliant on the United States, are tightening their cooperation.

headline: This French territory off the coast of Canada has 'no clear sense of worry' over Trump
subhead: Elected representatives in Saint-Pierre-et-Miquelon, the only French overseas territory in the North Atlantic, home to 6,000 people, aim to deepen ties with their major partner, Canada, amid growing geopolitical tensions with the US.

headline: The US versus human rights
'The Kurds had Western support, especially from the US. That support has now been withdrawn'
'Not only is Trump not crazy, but he is dangerous': Historian Laure Murat salutes Minneapolis 'lesson in democracy'
